entry.title: The Registered Pension Schemes (Co-ownership of Living Accommodation) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations apply where living accommodation is owned partly by a registered pension scheme and partly by other persons. The Regulations provide for a charge to income tax to arise in certain circumstances.

entry.title: The Registered Pension Schemes (Enhanced Lifetime Allowance) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: Part 4 of the Finance Act 2004 deals with pension schemes.

entry.title: The Registered Pension Schemes (Uprating Percentages for Defined Benefits Arrangements and Enhanced Protection Limits) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the alternative percentages by reference to which the opening value of defined benefits arrangements, and enhanced protection limits in paragraphs 15, 16 and 17 of Schedule 36 to the Finance Act 2004 (c. 12) are to be increased.

entry.title: The Doncaster and South Humber Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Northern Lincolnshire and Goole Hospitals National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the Doncaster and South Humber Healthcare National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Room 3W58, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Tuberculosis (England) (Amendment) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order, which applies in England only, amends the Tuberculosis (England) Order 2005 (SI 2005/3446) in two ways.

entry.title: The Potatoes Originating in Egypt (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in Scotland Commission Decision 2005/840/EC (O.J. No. L 312, 29.11.05, p.63) amending Commission Decision 2004/4/EC (“the principal Decision”) (O.J. No. L 2, 6.1.04, p.50) authorising Member States temporarily to take emergency measures against the dissemination of Pseudomonas solanacearum (Smith) Smith (now referred to as Ralstonia solanacearum (Smith) Yabuuchi et al.) as regards Egypt.

entry.title: The Social Security (Contributions) (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Contributions) Regulations 2001 (S.I. 2001/1004: “the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Ethical Standards in Public Life etc. (Scotland) Act 2000 (Codes of Conduct for Members of certain Scottish Public Authorities) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order specifies certain Scottish public authorities for the purposes of Part 4 of the Ethical Standards in Public Life etc. (Scotland) Act 2000. In terms of Part 4 of that Act the Scottish Ministers will require to issue a code of conduct in respect of the conduct of members of the Scottish public authorities specified by this Order.

title.div: The Waste (Household Waste Duty of Care) (Wales) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Gwastraff (Dyletswydd Gofal o ran Gwastraff Cartref) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: These Regulations are made under section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972. Their main aim is to implement, in relation to Wales, Article 8 of Council Directive 75/442/EEC on waste (the “Waste Framework Directive”) as respects an occupier of domestic property in relation to the household waste produced on the property.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn cael eu gwneud o dan adran 2(2) o Ddeddf y Cymunedau Ewropeaidd 1972. Eu prif nod yw gweithredu, o ran Cymru, Erthygl 8 o Gyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 75/442/EEC ar wastraff (y “Cyfarwyddeb Fframwaith Gwastraff”) o ran meddiannydd eiddo domestig mewn perthynas â'r gwastraff cartref a gynhyrchir ar yr eiddo.

entry.title: The Dairy Produce Quotas (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 31st March 2006, amend the Dairy Produce Quotas Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/465) (“the 2005 Regulations”).

title.div: The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (Wales) Order 2006 / Gorchymyn Cynllunio Gwlad a Thref (Datblygu Cyffredinol a Ganiateir) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: This Order amends Parts 1 and 25 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (“the 1995 Order”). These Parts confer permitted development rights in respect of the erection of satellite and microwave antenna (as defined in article 1(2) of the Order). The amendments apply in relation to Wales.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Rhannau 1 a 25 o Atodlen 2 i Orchymyn Cynllunio Gwlad a Thref (Datblygu Cyffredinol a Ganiateir) 1995 (“Gorchymyn 1995”). Mae'r Rhannau hynny yn rhoi hawliau datblygu a ganiateir mewn perthynas â chodi antena lloeren ac antena microdonfedd (fel y'i diffinnir yn erthygl 1(2) o'r Gorchymyn). Mae'r diwygiadau yn gymwys o ran Cymru.

entry.title: The Primary Medical Services (Scotland) Act 2004 (Modification of the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order makes modifications to the National Health Service (Scotland) Act 1978 (“the 1978 Act”). These modifications are for the purposes, or in consequence, of the Primary Medical Services (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) and include modifications in consequence of changes to the law applicable to Northern Ireland by the Primary Medical Services (Northern Ireland) Order 2004 corresponding to the changes made to the 1978 Act by the 2004 Act.

title.div: The Education (School Performance and Unauthorised Absence Targets) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Perfformiad Ysgol a Thargedau Absenoldeb heb Awdurdod) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2006

div.p: These Regulations amend the provisions relating to absence targets in the Education (School Performance and Unauthorised Absence Targets) (Wales) Regulations 1999 (“the 1999 Regulations”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio'r darpariaethau sy'n ymwneud â thargedau absenoldeb yn Rheoliadau Addysg (Perfformiad Ysgol a Thargedau Absenoldeb heb Awdurdod) (Cymru) 1999 (“Rheoliadau 1999”).

title.div: The Assembly Learning Grants and Loans (Higher Education) (Wales) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Grantiau a Benthyciadau Dysgu y Cynulliad (Addysg Uwch) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: These Regulations provide for financial support for students who are ordinarily resident in Wales taking designated higher education courses in respect of the academic year beginning on or after 1 September 2006.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer cymorth ariannol i fyfyrwyr sydd fel arfer yn preswylio yng Nghymru ac sy'n dilyn cyrsiau addysg uwch dynodedig mewn perthynas â'r flwyddyn academaidd sy'n dechrau ar neu ar ôl 1 Medi 2006.

title.div: The Feeding Stuffs (Wales) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Bwydydd Anifeiliaid (Cymru) 2006

div.p: These Regulations which apply in relation to Wales—revoke with certain exceptions, the provisions of the Feeding Stuffs (Wales) Regulations 2001 (as last amended by S.I. 2004/3091 (W.265), (“the 2001 Regulations”)) (regulation 7);re-enact with or without amendments, the majority of the provisions of the 2001 Regulations; andintroduce new provisions to enforce and administer Regulation (EC) No. 1831/2003 on additives for use in animal nutrition.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn sy'n gymwys o ran Cymru—yn dirymu, gyda rhai eithriadau, ddarpariaethau Rheoliadau Porthiant (Cymru) 2001 (fel y'u diwygiwyd ddiwethaf gan O.S. 2004/3091 (Cy.265), (“Rheoliadau 2001”)) (rheoliad 7);yn ailddeddfu, gyda diwygiadau neu hebddynt, y mwyafrif o ddarpariaethau Rheoliadau 2001; acyn cyflwyno darpariaethau newydd i orfodi ac i weinyddu Rheoliad (EC) Rhif 1831/2003 ar ychwanegion sydd i'w defnyddio ar gyfer maethiad anifeiliaid.

entry.title: The Police Act 1996 (Local Policing Summaries) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order specifies matters which must be included in local policing summaries issued by police authorities pursuant to section 8A of the Police Act 1996.

entry.title: The Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (Delegation under section 43) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order prescribes the grade of Deputy Director of the Serious Organised Crime Agency (“SOCA”) as the prescribed level for the purposes of section 44(1) of the Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005. The effect of section 44 of that Act is that the Director General of SOCA cannot delegate his functions under section 43 (designation of SOCA staff as persons having the powers of constable etc.) to an employee of that Agency who is employed in a grade lower than the grade of Deputy Director of SOCA.

entry.title: The Lloyd’s Underwriters (Conversion to Limited Liability Underwriting) (Tax) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: Under the rules of Lloyd's, an individual member of Lloyd’s may transfer his underwriting business to a company or a Scottish limited partnership (known as “conversion” to limited liability underwriting). Schedule 20A to the Finance Act 1993 allows members so converting to carry forward income tax losses and claim CGT rollover relief on the disposal of certain business assets. A Scottish limited partnership which takes over an individual’s underwriting business on such a conversion is defined in Schedule 20A to the Finance Act 1993 as a “successor partnership.”

entry.title: The Working Time (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations, which are made under section 2(2) of the European Communities Act 1972 (c. 68), amend the Working Time Regulations 1998. The Working Time Regulations 1998 implement Council Directive 2003/88/EC (O.J. No L229 18.11.2003, p.9) (which consolidates Directive 93/104/EC (O.J. No. L307, 13.12.93, p18) as amended by Council Directive 2000/34/EC (O.J. No L195, 01.08.2000, p.41) as from 2 August 2004).

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (England) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order amends Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995. Part 3 confers permitted development rights in respect of certain changes of use. Where such rights apply, no specific application for planning permission is needed.
